This game is an absolute banger, Supercell's take on real time strategy with millions of different possibilities at the tip of your fingers is incredibly well executed overall, that being said, in its current state I'd say it can become frustrating to play as its pay to fast scheme gives players too much of an advantage over free to play. This issue has been growing worse over time, leaving certain players outside of the competitive scene. All in all, great game, HORRENDOUS progression.

This game has been on a steady decline for the last 9y. I was a very good player at one point (top 1000 local), but ever since the Slash Royale scam I've been playing less and less. The nail in the coffin was lv15. Ever since then it has truly become an unplayable cesspool. As soon as you enter the game you immediately get bombarded by $50 offers left and right. Now they want to introduce lv16. Somebody at Supersell must be smoking nailpolish.

Merge Tactics is rigged especially when you reach Gold III and you want to climb up to Diamond rank. For example, in a match, if you don't merge a trait or upgrade a 1 troop to 2 stars within round 1 to round 2 then congrats you're screwed. You'll surely be placed in the top 3 or top 4. The reason behind this is the questionable shuffle of the cards in the early rounds, feels like the game itself chooses who will be the lucky players (randomly) to make it to the top 2.

Clash Royale excels with fast, tactical battles and fresh modes like 2v2 League. Yet, removing the season shop shifts focus from passionate, skill-driven gameplay to a spending-driven model. The extended 10,000+ trophy progression rewards strategy but blurs the line between skill and monetization. This evolving balance challenges longtime fans as the game grows less passion-based, which may disappoint dedicated players.
